Uses of Package

Packages that use net.parallaxed.bluejam.evolution

net.parallaxed.bluejam.evolution   
 

Classes in net.parallaxed.bluejam.evolution used by net.parallaxed.bluejam
FitnessType
          Defines which types of fitness are available to the system.
Genotype
          Names and stored reference to the underlying implementations of Genomes available in the system.
InitializationType
          Defines the possible initialization types for the evolution process.
SelectionType
          An enum containing the possible selection algorithms that can be used.
 

Classes in net.parallaxed.bluejam.evolution used by net.parallaxed.bluejam.evolution
Breeder
          Classes implementing this interface must fill a population to it's maximum capacity through the use of crossover and mutation to create new individuals.
FitnessContour
          Computes a fitness value for the contour of the supplied NoteSequence.
FitnessDistance
          Implements a measure of fitness by comparing the result of an individual to its original heuristic through means analysing each note in the sequence to see that it is sufficiently displaced from those around it.
FitnessInterval
          This class selects a random fitness method to apply.
FitnessRandom
          Picks a random fitness evaluation method and returns the result.
FitnessStacked
          Tracks which individuals have already been measured by the function, and applies different fitness measures each time.
FitnessType
          Defines which types of fitness are available to the system.
Genotype
          Names and stored reference to the underlying implementations of Genomes available in the system.
HeuristicSelectionType
          When initializing the population, the set of loaded heuristics can be assigned randomly or evenly.
IndividualEvaluator
          Describes what arguments an implementing class (fitness function) must take.
IndividualSelector
          Implementing classes should design selection algorithms that can accept a population as input, and produce another (skeleton) population as output.
InitializationType
          Defines the possible initialization types for the evolution process.
InitializeGrow
          This form of the grow algorithm psuedorandomly selects a rhythm with which to assign the note before adding it to the tree (having the effect of choosing all functions down to that depth, and the final terminal).
InitializeHeuristicTree
          Initializes note sequences using crossover on the heuristics, as defined by the TreeBreeder method, breed(NoteTree,NoteTree).
InitializeRandom
          Implements a random initialization.
NoteContext.Contour
          Contour defines the overall progression of a NoteSequence.
NoteSequenceInitializer
          Initializers are singletons that can accept a reference to a NoteSequence and fill it with notes using the algorithm they define.
PropertyFactory
          Deprecated.  
RhythmInitializer
          Initializes Rhythm and other contextual properties for a passed note sequence using a static probabilistic model.
SelectionType
          An enum containing the possible selection algorithms that can be used.
SelectTournament
          Performs a variant of tournament selection.
